This unit aims to firstly develop an understanding of key features of methods for mathematically
modelling various categories of dynamical systems in terms of sets of dynamic and algebraic

column2: ranging from engineering to biomedical systems. Secondly

column1: write algorithms for efficient numerical solution of these equations. Computer-aided control
systems design using optimal and robust control methods is then covered. Thirdly
introduced to Lyapunov and function analytic techniques for nonlinear systems stability analysis
and to nonlinear control design methods including feedback linearisation

column2: 3 hours laboratory and practice classes and 7 hours private study per week

6. Design and simulate controllers and observers using computer-aided tools.
